description.narrative: Syria's conflict-affected population have their critical Education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: MENARO delivers timely, equitable and principled humanitarian action as a complement to country office-led operations where required, including through the cross-border component of the Syria programmes as part of the Whole of Syria response.

participating-org.narrative: IHSAN INSANI YARDIM VE DAYANSMA DERNEGI

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Middle East and North Africa Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Syria's conflict-affected population have their critical Education needs met, in line with the HRP and as part of the UNICEF JOP

description.narrative: During reporting period, UNICEF has achieved and expanded its education targets for children enrolled in non-formal education, training teachers and education personnel and the number of children benefiting from life skills; while enrolment targets for non-formal education are two thirds complete, and the target for formal education is low, with only 28% of the target reached. From Jan to December 2019, 353930 children benefitted from education services in North West Syria. The Education cluster capacity was strengthened through provision of various training benefiting 173 members of active NGOs working in NWS. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/04/2020
